intro: Juanulloa aurantiaca, commonly known as the red-flowered juanulloa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Juanulloa aurantiaca is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
